newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan state fund to sell bank shares in 4 years.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan state fund to sell bank shares in 4 years.

text.p: A parliamentary sub-committee has ordered a cabinet fund to sell all its stakes in three financial institutions within four years instead of the previous planned two years, an official said on Thursday.

"The parliamentary sub-committee on Wednesday revised its April decision, demanding that the Development Fund sell all its stakes in the three institutions in four years, by June 2001," an official at the fund told Reuters.
The fund now holds 42 percent in International Commercial Bank of Cnina, 16.5 percent in China Bills Finance and 14 percent in Overseas Chinese Bank.
On April 16, the same committee ordered the fund to sell all its stakes in the three institutions in two years.
The official did not give a reason for the change in the timetable. Local newspapers said a sell-down within two years would be too big a shock to the hypersensitive stock market.
Taiwan's lawmakers had said that because the cabinet fund was formed to help upgrade local industries, it should not invest in the financial sector.
The committee's resolution needs final approval from the entire parliament.
Local newspapers estimated on Thursday that the cabinet fund would profit around T$70 billion by selling all its bank shares based on current market prices.
The official declined to confirm the figures.
"We haven't made price evaluations and we don't have proposals on how to release these shares now," she said.
"But the principle is to gradually release them so as not to affect the stock market."
The local Liberty Times newspaper reported that mainland Chinese shareholders hold 30 percent of International Commercial Bank.
The newspaper said that China shareholders may control the bank's management after Taiwan's cabinet fund withdraws all its stakes.
The fund official said she could not confirm the report.
The bank moved its base from the mainland to Taiwan in 1949 after Taiwan's Nationalist government lost a civil war in China to communist troops.
